de.boereck.matcher.function.optionalmap

Interface OptionalMapper<I,O>

  • Type Parameters:
    I - type of input to function
    O - type of optional output of function
    All Superinterfaces:
    Function<I,Optional<O>>
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface OptionalMapper<I,O>
extends Function<I,Optional<O>>
    Function mapping an input of type I to an Optional<O>. The result of this function should never be null, even though most combinator methods of this interface are prepared for this. This interface is especially useful when working with NoResultCaseMatcher.caseObj(java.util.function.Function, java.util.function.Consumer) or ResultCaseMatcher.caseOf(java.util.function.BooleanSupplier, java.util.function.Function).
    See Also:
    MatchHelpers.cast(Class)

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default <R> OptionalMapper<I,R> filter(Class<R> clazz)
      Returns an optional mapper filtering the Optional returned by this OptionalMapper with the given class clazz.
      default OptionalMapper<I,O> filter(Predicate<O> after)
      Returns an optional mapper filtering the Optional returned by this OptionalMapper with the given predicate after.
      default <V> OptionalMapper<I,V> flatMap(Function<? super O,Optional<V>> after)
      Returns a function that will first call this OptionalMapper and afterwards calls the flatMap method of the returned Optional with the given mapping function after.
      default <V> OptionalDoubleMapper<I> flatMapD(Function<? super O,OptionalDouble> after)
      Returns a function that will first call this OptionalMapper and afterwards calls function after on the optional result.
      default OptionalIntMapper<I> flatMapI(Function<? super O,OptionalInt> after)
      Returns a function that will first call this OptionalMapper and afterwards calls function after on the optional result.
      default <V> OptionalLongMapper<I> flatMapL(Function<? super O,OptionalLong> after)
      Returns a function that will first call this OptionalMapper and afterwards calls function after on the optional result.
      default Predicate<I> hasResult()
      This method returns a predicate checking if the optional returned by this OptionalMapper is not null and holds a value.
      default Predicate<I> hasResultAnd(Predicate<O> test)
      This method returns a predicate checking if the optional returned by this OptionalMapper is not null, holds a value, and if the predicate test returns true for this value.
      default <V> OptionalMapper<I,V> map(Function<? super O,? extends V> after)
      Returns a Function that will first call this OptionalMapper and afterwards calls the map function of the returned Optional with the given mapping function after.
      default OptionalDoubleMapper<I> mapD(ToDoubleFunction<? super O> after)
      Returns a function that will first call this OptionalMapper and afterwards calls function after on the result.
      default OptionalIntMapper<I> mapI(ToIntFunction<? super O> after)
      Returns a function that will first call this OptionalMapper and afterwards calls function after on the result.
      default OptionalLongMapper<I> mapL(ToLongFunction<? super O> after)
      Returns a function that will first call this OptionalMapper and afterwards calls function after on the result.
      default OptionalMapper<I,O> nullAware()
      This method will return a function that checks if the input is null and if so returns an empty optional.

      Returns a function that takes an input value, calls this OptionalMapper with it, and calls orElse on the returned Optional with the given value o.

      Returns a function that takes an input value, calls this OptionalMapper with it, and calls orElseGet on the returned Optional with the given value supplier.
      default TestableFunction<I,O> partial()
      Converts this optional mapper to a function that will perform the mapper and check if there is a result available and return it.

      Returns a function executing this OptionalMapper and if a an exception of type E is thrown during the execution, the given recovery function is used to provide a value to be returned.

      Returns a function executing this OptionalMapper and if a throwable is thrown during the execution, the given recovery function is used to provide a value to be returned.

      Returns a consumer that takes an input value, calls this OptionalMapper with it, and feeds the result to the given consumer.

      Returns a consumer that takes an input value, calls this OptionalMapper with it, if the returned Optional holds a value, feeds this value to the given consumer.

    • Method Detail

      • map

        default <V> OptionalMapper<I,V> map(Function<? super O,? extends V> after)
                             throws NullPointerException
        Returns a Function that will first call this OptionalMapper and afterwards calls the map function of the returned Optional with the given mapping function after. If the result of this OptionalMapper is null, an empty Optional will be returned.
        Type Parameters:
        V - result type of after mapping function.
        Parameters:
        after - mapping function that will be called on the returned Optional of this OptionalMapper. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        method that will first call this OptionalMapper and afterwards calls the map function of the returned Optional with the given mapping function after.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if parameter after is null.

      • mapI

        default OptionalIntMapper<I> mapI(ToIntFunction<? super O> after)
                           throws NullPointerException
        Returns a function that will first call this OptionalMapper and afterwards calls function after on the result. If this OptionalMapper returns an optional that holds a value an optional holding the result will be returned, otherwise an empty optional will be returned. If the result of this OptionalMapper is null, an empty Optional will be returned from the resulting function being returned.
        Parameters:
        after - mapping function that will be called on the returned Optional of this OptionalMapper. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        function that will first call this OptionalMapper and afterwards calls function after on the result, if this OptionalMapper returns an optional that holds a value an optional holding the result will be returned, otherwise an empty optional will be returned.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if parameter after is null.

      • flatMap

        default <V> OptionalMapper<I,V> flatMap(Function<? super O,Optional<V>> after)
                                 throws NullPointerException
        Returns a function that will first call this OptionalMapper and afterwards calls the flatMap method of the returned Optional with the given mapping function after. If the result of this OptionalMapper is null, an empty Optional will be returned.
        Type Parameters:
        V - type of element held by the returned optional, which is the result type of the returned function
        Parameters:
        after - mapping function that will be called on the returned Optional of this OptionalMapper. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        function that will first call this OptionalMapper and afterwards calls the flatMap method of the returned Optional with the given mapping function after.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if parameter after is null.

      • flatMapI

        default OptionalIntMapper<I> flatMapI(Function<? super O,OptionalInt> after)
                               throws NullPointerException
        Returns a function that will first call this OptionalMapper and afterwards calls function after on the optional result. Meaning, if this OptionalMapper returns an optional holding a value, the result of after (called with the content of the option) is returned. Otherwise an empty optional will be returned. If the result of this OptionalMapper is null, an empty Optional will be returned from the resulting function.
        Parameters:
        after - function being called on the result value of this::apply, if the optional result exists. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        function that will first call this OptionalMapper and afterwards calls function after on the optional result.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if parameter after is null.

Meaning, if this OptionalMapper returns an optional holding a value, the result of after (called with the content of the option) is returned. Otherwise an empty optional will be returned. If the result of this OptionalMapper is null, an empty Optional will be returned from the resulting function.

        Parameters:

      • filter

        default OptionalMapper<I,O> filter(Predicate<O> after)
                            throws NullPointerException
        Returns an optional mapper filtering the Optional returned by this OptionalMapper with the given predicate after. This means that function returns an empty Optional if either this OptionalMapper returns null, or an empty Optional, or if the Optional returned from this OptionalMapper holds a value, but the predicate after returns false for the value held in the Optional. If the predicate reutrns true, the function will return the Optional returned from this OptionalMapper.
        Parameters:
        after - function being used to call filter on the Optional returned from this OptionalMapper. This parameter must not be null.
        Returns:
        optional mapper filtering the Optional returned by this OptionalMapper with the given predicate after.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - will be thrown if after is null.

      • filter

        default <R> OptionalMapper<I,R> filter(Class<R> clazz)
                                throws NullPointerException
        Returns an optional mapper filtering the Optional returned by this OptionalMapper with the given class clazz. This means that function returns an empty Optional if either this OptionalMapper returns null, or an empty Optional, or if the Optional returned from this OptionalMapper holds an object not instance of clazz. If the object in the Optional is instance of clazz, the function will return an optional holding the object of type clazz.
        Type Parameters:
        R - Type of object held in optional returned by the function, returned by this method.
        Parameters:
        clazz - Class the object contained in the Optional returned by this OptionalMapper is checked for.
        Returns:
        optional mapper filtering the Optional returned by this OptionalMapper by class clazz.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - will be thrown if clazz is null.

      • hasResult

        default Predicate<I> hasResult()
        This method returns a predicate checking if the optional returned by this OptionalMapper is not null and holds a value.
        Returns:
        predicate checking if optional returned by this OptionalMapper holds a value. is not null and holds a value.

      • hasResultAnd

        default Predicate<I> hasResultAnd(Predicate<O> test)
                           throws NullPointerException
        This method returns a predicate checking if the optional returned by this OptionalMapper is not null, holds a value, and if the predicate test returns true for this value.
        Parameters:
        test - predicate checking if the result value returned by this OptionalMapper
        Returns:
        predicate checking if optional value returned by this OptionalMapper is tested positive. is not null, holds a value, and if the predicate test returns true for this value.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - will be thrown if test is null.

      • thenDo

        default Consumer<I> thenDo(Consumer<Optional<? super O>> consumer)
                    throws NullPointerException
        Returns a consumer that takes an input value, calls this OptionalMapper with it, and feeds the result to the given consumer.
        Parameters:
        consumer - consumes the result of this OptionalMapper, when the returned Consumer is invoked.
        Returns:
        consumer that takes an input value, calls this OptionalMapper with it, and feeds the result to the parameter consumer.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if consumer is null.

      • thenIfPresent

        default Consumer<I> thenIfPresent(Consumer<? super O> consumer)
                           throws NullPointerException
        Returns a consumer that takes an input value, calls this OptionalMapper with it, if the returned Optional holds a value, feeds this value to the given consumer.
        Parameters:
        consumer - consumes the result value of the Optional returned by this OptionalMapper (if value is present), when the returned Consumer is invoked.
        Returns:
        consumer that takes an input value, calls this OptionalMapper with it, and feeds the content of the resulting Optional to the parameter consumer (if value exists).
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if consumer is null.

      • orElse

        default TestableFunction<I,O> orElse(O o)
        Returns a function that takes an input value, calls this OptionalMapper with it, and calls orElse on the returned Optional with the given value o. If the Optional returned by this OptionalMapper is null, the function will return value o.
        Parameters:
        o - value that will be returned from the function returned by this method if either this OptionalMapper returns null, or an empty Optional.
        Returns:
        function that takes an input value, calls this OptionalMapper with it, and calls orElse on the returned Optional with the given value o. If the Optional returned by this OptionalMapper is null, the function will return value o.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if consumer is null.

      • orElseGet

        default TestableFunction<I,O> orElseGet(Supplier<O> supplier)
                                 throws NullPointerException
        Returns a function that takes an input value, calls this OptionalMapper with it, and calls orElseGet on the returned Optional with the given value supplier. If the Optional returned by this OptionalMapper is null, the function will return the value provided by supplier.
        Parameters:
        supplier - supplies value that will be returned from the function returned by this method if either this OptionalMapper returns null, or an empty Optional.
        Returns:
        function taking an input value, calls this OptionalMapper with it, and calls orElseGet on the returned Optional with the given value supplier. If the Optional returned by this OptionalMapper is null, the function will return the value provided by supplier.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if consumer is null.

      • nullAware

        default OptionalMapper<I,O> nullAware()
        This method will return a function that checks if the input is null and if so returns an empty optional. Otherwise it will call this OptionalMapper and if the result is not null, returns it. If the result is null, an empty Optional will be returned. So effectively null checks will be performed on input and output of the function. Exceptions being thrown during the execution of this OptionalMapper will also be thrown at the caller of the returned function.
        Returns:
        function that checks if the input is null and if so returns an empty optional. Otherwise it will call this OptionalMapper and if the result is not null, returns it. If the result is null, an empty Optional will be returned.

      • withCatch

        default OptionalMapper<I,O> withCatch()
        The returned function will execute this OptionalMapper and if it executes without any problem, the result will be returned. If the execution throws an Exception, this will be caught and swallowed(!); the function will return an empty Optional in this case. It is recommended to handle the exception, e.g. by using method <E extends Throwable> withCatch(Class<E>, Consumer<E>) or withCatch(Consumer<Exception>) instead.
        Returns:
        function that will execute this OptionalMapper and if it executes without any problem, the result will be returned. If the execution throws an Exception, this will be caught and swallowed(!); the function will return an empty Optional in this case.

      • withCatch

        default <E extends Throwable> OptionalMapper<I,O> withCatch(Class<E> clazz,
                                                            Consumer<E> handler)
        The returned function will execute this OptionalMapper and if it executes without any problem, the result will be returned. If the execution throws an throwable of type clazz, it will be caught and the consumer handler will be called with the Exception; the function will return an empty Optional in this case. Throwables of other types will be re-thrown. If the handler itself will throw an exception, it will not be caught and propagated to the caller of the function.
        Type Parameters:
        E - type of throwable to be caught
        Parameters:
        clazz - type of throwable to be caught
        handler - consumer handling the throwable
        Returns:
        function that will execute this OptionalMapper and potentially handling exceptions of type clazz with handler. After handling exceptions, the function will return an empty Optional.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if handler or handler is null.

      • withCatch

        default OptionalMapper<I,O> withCatch(Consumer<Exception> handler)
                               throws NullPointerException
        The returned function will execute this OptionalMapper and if it executes without any problem, the result will be returned. If the execution throws an exception, it will be caught and the consumer handler will be called with the exception; the function will return an empty Optional in this case. If the handler itself will throw an exception, it will not be caught and propagated to the caller of the function.
        Parameters:
        handler - will handle exceptions being thrown during the execution of this OptionalMapper
        Returns:
        function execution this OptionalMapper and if execution performs without any problem, the result will be returned. If the execution throws an exception of type clazz, it will be caught and the consumer handler will be called with the exception; the function will return an empty Optional in this case.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if handler is null.

      • recoverWith

        default OptionalMapper<I,O> recoverWith(Function<? super Throwable,Optional<O>> recovery)
                                 throws NullPointerException
        Returns a function executing this OptionalMapper and if a throwable is thrown during the execution, the given recovery function is used to provide a value to be returned. If an empty Optional should be returned, consider using method withCatch() instead. If the recovery method itself will throw an exception, it will not be caught and propagated to the caller of the function.
        Parameters:
        recovery - method providing a regular result value if the OptionalMapper throws an exception.
        Returns:
        function executing this OptionalMapper and if a throwable is thrown during the execution, the given recovery function is used to provide a value to be returned. If an empty Optional should be returned, consider using method withCatch() instead.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if recovery is null.

      • recoverWith

        default <E extends Throwable> OptionalMapper<I,O> recoverWith(Class<E> clazz,
                                                              Function<? super E,Optional<O>> recovery)
                                                       throws NullPointerException
        Returns a function executing this OptionalMapper and if a an exception of type E is thrown during the execution, the given recovery function is used to provide a value to be returned. Exceptions of other types will be re-thrown to the caller. If the recovery method itself will throw an exception, it will not be caught and propagated to the caller of the function.
        Type Parameters:
        E - Type of exceptions to be caught and recovered from.
        Parameters:
        clazz - class of exceptions to be caught and recovered from.
        recovery - function recovering from an exception providing a regular value to return from the returned function.
        Returns:
        function executing this OptionalMapper and if a an exception of type E is thrown during the execution, the given recovery function is used to provide a value to be returned. Exceptions of other types will be re-thrown to the caller.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if handler or recovery is null.

      • partial

        default TestableFunction<I,O> partial()
        Converts this optional mapper to a function that will perform the mapper and check if there is a result available and return it. If the returned optional is null or empty, the function will throw a NoSuchElementException.
        Returns:
        function not defined on inputs produce empty optionals. This means that if there this mapper produces an optional holding a value, this will be returned. Otherwise a NoSuchElementException is thrown.
